intro: Astragalus jabalambrensis, commonly known as the Jordanian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has compound leaves with small leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitats.
